\lhead{Reversible}
\chead{Curvature}

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}

\title{Calculating Curvature}


\author{Tom Fei}

\maketitle
We define $\delta_{e}(A)=PI(A\cup\{e\})-PI(A)$
\begin{enumerate}
\item Compute curvature 
\[
\alpha_{i}(e)=1-\dfrac{\delta_{e}(S_{i-1})}{\delta_{e}(\emptyset)}
\]
for each round $i$ based on the recommendation set of the previous
round, $S_{i-1}$ (we define $S_{0}=\emptyset$).
\item Compute curvature
\[
\alpha(e)=1-\dfrac{\delta_{e}(S)}{\delta_{e}(\emptyset)}
\]
by sampling peptides uniformly from $E$, the space of all peptides,
using the final recommendation set $S$ for 10 hours.
\item What to report

\begin{enumerate}
\item $\alpha(e)$ and $\alpha_{i}(e)$ for all $e$
\item Mean, std, max and min
\item Store $\alpha(e)$ and $\alpha_{i}(e)$ in textfiles
\item Plot distribution of $\alpha(e)$ and $\alpha_{i}(e)$ (using histogram)
\end{enumerate}
\item Derivations

\begin{enumerate}
\item $\alpha_{i}(e)$
\begin{eqnarray*}
\alpha_{i}(e) & = & 1-\dfrac{\delta_{e}(S_{i-1})}{\delta_{e}(\emptyset)}\\
 & = & 1-\dfrac{PI(S_{i-1}\cup\{e\})-PI(S_{i-1})}{PI(\{e\})}\\
 & = & 1-\dfrac{\mathbb{P}(Y(e)=1\mid Y(x_{j})=0,j=1,\ldots,i-1)\prod_{j=1}^{i-1}\mathbb{P}(Y(x_{j})=0\mid Y(x_{j'})=0,\forall j'<j)}{\mathbb{P}(Y(e)=1)}
\end{eqnarray*}

\item $\alpha(e)$: Assuming $|S|=k$,
\begin{eqnarray*}
\alpha(e) & = & 1-\dfrac{\delta_{e}(S)}{\delta_{e}(\emptyset)}\\
 & = & 1-\dfrac{PI(S\cup\{e\})-PI(S)}{PI(\{e\})}\\
 & = & 1-\dfrac{\mathbb{P}(Y(e)=1\mid Y(x_{j})=0,j=1,\ldots,k)\prod_{j=1}^{k}\mathbb{P}(Y(x_{j})=0\mid Y(x_{j'})=0,\forall j'<j)}{\mathbb{P}(Y(e)=1)}
\end{eqnarray*}
Note that all probabilities are implicitly conditional on training
data (trainX in the code).\end{enumerate}
\end{enumerate}

\end{document}
